Package info.kgeorgiy.ja.nazarov.implementor

Class Implementor

java.lang.Object
info.kgeorgiy.ja.nazarov.implementor.Implementor
All Implemented Interfaces:
info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.Impler, info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.JarImpler
public class Implementor extends Object implements info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.JarImpler
Implementation of the JarImpler interface. Provides the ability to create an interface implementation and compiling it into a JAR file.

  • Constructor Details

    • Implementor

      public Implementor()
      The default constructor for Implementor. Creates an instance of the Implementor class that can be used to generate interface implementations and create corresponding JAR files.

    • compileClass

      private void compileClass(Class<?> token, Path root) throws info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException
      Compiles a class that implements the interface specified in the token parameter.
      Parameters:
      token - is the interface class for which you need to create an implementation.
      root - is the path to the directory where the compiled class will be saved.
      Throws:
      info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException - If compilation failed.

    • createJar

      private void createJar(Class<?> token, Path tempDir, Path jarFile) throws info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException
      Creates a JAR file containing the compiled interface implementation class.
      Parameters:
      token - The interface class for which the implementation was created.
      tempDir - is a temporary directory containing compiled classes.
      jarFile - is the path to the JAR file being created.
      Throws:
      info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException - If JAR file creation failed.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The entry point to the program. Processes command line arguments and starts the process of creating an interface implementation or creating a JAR file with the implementation.
      Parameters:
      args - Command line arguments.
